result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with Taylor Hall Nanez, Katie Chandler, Jimmy Castro Jr or Christian Tadeo Munoz.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
Same non-monetary conditions as imposed in Ct 1.

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Jeff Morrell.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1); Court so orders.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended and Ct 3.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1 and on Ct 3.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Def req expungement; Court denies request.
Hearing at 11-10-2015 02:45 pm

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey Morrell.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State. Counsel's first appearance; offer rec'd, anticipates resolution.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Petition for Appointment of Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order.
Signature Bond amended to Cash Bond - same conditions - no contact with J.C. Jr, C.M., K.C., T.N.; maintain absolute sobriety
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing at 09-23-2015 08:15 am

Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State. Court appoints Atty. Jeffrey Morrell at county expense; defendant shall reimburse the county at $40 per month 10/1/15.   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Court amends bond to $1,150 cash bond w/same conditions.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Two bonds set - (1) signature, (1) cash; to be addressed at next hearing per direction of Court
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with K.C.; T.N.; J.C Jr.; C.M.
Hearing at 08-24-2015 08:15 am

Def appeared in person.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court finds typographical error in complaint and makes handwritten change.  Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $1200 signature bond.     Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance at 08-03-2015 08:15 am
Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office; COC Rec#14R 019982 dated 10/6/14
